## Working with Master Plan 2014 Subzone Boundary Data

Install and load **sf** and **tidyverse** packages into R environment.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, sf)
```
:::


This code chunk imports shapefile.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz14_shp <- st_read(dsn = "data/", layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\ImmanuelLeong\IS415-Geospatial\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
class(mpsz14_shp)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "sf"         "data.frame"
```


:::
:::


This code chunk imports kml file.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# mpsz14_kml <- st_read("data/MasterPlan2014SubzoneBoundaryWebKML.kml")
```
:::


The second code chunk does not work due to a problem with the source. We use the following code chunk to export **mpsz14_shp** into kml format and save the output in the data subfolder.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_write(mpsz14_shp, 
         "data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml",
         delete_dsn = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Deleting source `data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' to data source 
  `data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing 323 features with 15 fields and geometry type Multi Polygon.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#delete_dsn = TRUE avoids Error: Dataset already exists.
```
:::


## Working with Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary Data

This code chunk imports shapefile.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19_shp <- st_read(dsn = "data/", layer = "MPSZ-2019")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\ImmanuelLeong\IS415-Geospatial\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


This code chunk imports kml.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19_kml <- st_read("data/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `URA_MP19_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\ImmanuelLeong\IS415-Geospatial\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data\MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY, XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


Transform the data to the **svy21** projected coordinate system.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19_shp <- st_read(dsn = "data/", layer = "MPSZ-2019") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\ImmanuelLeong\IS415-Geospatial\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19_kml <- st_read("data/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `URA_MP19_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\ImmanuelLeong\IS415-Geospatial\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data\MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY, XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


Check the CRS.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_crs(mpsz19_shp)
```


:::

## Working with Population Data

Import the data.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata <- read_csv("data/respopagesextod2023.csv")
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = AG, values_from = POP)

colnames(popdata2023)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "PA"          "SZ"          "0_to_4"      "10_to_14"    "15_to_19"   
 [6] "20_to_24"    "25_to_29"    "30_to_34"    "35_to_39"    "40_to_44"   
[11] "45_to_49"    "50_to_54"    "55_to_59"    "5_to_9"      "60_to_64"   
[16] "65_to_69"    "70_to_74"    "75_to_79"    "80_to_84"    "85_to_89"   
[21] "90_and_Over"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate(`YOUNG` = rowSums(.[3:6]) + rowSums(.[14])) %>%
  mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:13]) + rowSums(.[15])) %>%
  mutate(`AGED` = rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
  mutate(`TOTAL` = rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%
  mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`) / `ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
  select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`,`ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)
```
:::


Joining **popdata2023** and **mpsz19_shp**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), .funs = list(toupper))
  
pop2023_mpsz <- left_join(popdata2023, mpsz19_shp, by = c("SZ" = "SUBZONE_N"))
```
:::
